athlete.bdy:

Please this article or section. Help improve this article by adding . (April 2008)''
Cornelius Ingram (born on June 10, 1985 in
Hawthorne, Florida ) is an American football tight end. He saw playing time at shooting guard for the
University of Florida
's basketball team during the 2004-2005 seasons before focusing only on football in the summer of 2005. Ingram is a fifth-year senior senior tight end who moved from quarterback during the 2005 season.
2004 season (Squad Team)
He practiced at quarterback on the scout team, but did not see any game action. He was the scout team “Player of the Week” vs.
Arkansas . He joined the UF basketball team October 15 for practice and played in 19 games as a true freshman on that squad.
2005 season
He played in two games in the season that saw him move from quarterback to tight end. He saw action at quarterback in the victory over Louisiana Tech, directing one offensive drive in the fourth quarter. He appeared in several offensive plays at wide receiver throughout the
Outback Bowl
against
Iowa
. The Gators won 31-24.
2006 season
Had 30 receptions for 380 yards (12.7 avg.) and one touchdown in 14 games… Had 20 receptions for 267 yards over the final five games of the campaign… Totaled 58 yards on four catches against Ohio State, with a team long of 20 yards… Had a career night in Atlanta, making six catches for 71 yards – both personal highs… Had a long reception of 28 yards from Chris Leak in the fourth quarter… Caught three passes for 29 yards at Florida State… Caught a team-high four passes and totaled 59 yards receiving in the rout of Western Carolina, setting personal best in both categories for the second-straight week… Equaled a career high with three receptions and set a personal best with 50 yards receiving in the win over South Carolina… Helped the Gators convert a 3rd down and 5 late in the second quarter with a seven-yard reception against Georgia… Made one catch for six yards versus LSU… Caught two passes for 13 yards and had his first career touchdown in the 26-7 win over Kentucky… Finalized the scoring in the fourth quarter on a six-yard pass from Chris Leak… Recorded two catches for 40 receiving yards, including a career long catch of 38 yards… Made the most of his first career start against UCF with three catches for 35 yards. Also had a 15-yard grab… Hauled in first career reception, a 12-yarder from Leak, on Florida’s initial scoring drive of the campaign.
2007 season
Played in all 13 games, receiving starts against Tennessee, LSU, Vanderbilt, South Carolina and Florida Atlantic… Was fourth on the team with 34 receptions, averaging just under 15 yards per catch… Compiled 508 yards receiving, also ranking fourth on the team… Tied for the team lead in touchdown catches with Andre Caldwell (seven)… Had at least one reception in 12 of the 13 games he played… Caught two touchdowns against Florida Atlantic for the first time in his career, connections of four and 26 yards… Tied for the team lead in receptions in the win against Florida State with five… Had two catches for 16 yards in his fourth start of the year against South Carolina… One yard shy of his career-long reception against LSU, hauling in a 37-yard touchdown… Scored touchdowns in back-to-back games on two occasions, against the Trojans and Volunteers and in games against LSU and Kentucky… Contributed three catches for 56 yards in the SEC-opening home win over Tennessee… Had career high numbers against Troy, posting seven catches and 105 yards, the first time in his career he had over 100 yards of receiving… Reeled in one pass for 11 yards in his season debut against Western Kentucky… Member of the Leadership Committee.
2008 season
On August 6, 2008, he seriously injured knee ligaments during fall practice. As a result, he will miss his entire senior season. He is expected to apply for the 2009 NFL draft.
Honors and awards
In 2007, he was selected to the second team All-SEC by AP and coaches. He was also a candidate for the
John Mackey Award
presented to the nation’s best tight end.
Family
Cornelius' uncle played in the NFL for the
Tampa Bay Buccaneers
. His uncle, Jaime MacDonald, played
fullback
, but converted to tight end because he was so big. Jaime's son and Cornelius' cousin was a teammate of fellow
Florida Gators player, Shawn Schmieder, in high school.
